instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message:
Working on another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has a few issues. It has no trackpad or keyboard, and is also missing Bluetooth ("no information" in system profiler). I checked all associated resistors, and they all check out fine. This isn't a liquid-damaged board. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is present at pin 22 of J5800 and pin 30 of J5713. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.36v.

<CHIP>U2700</CHIP> measurements:

pin 1: 0v
2: 0v
3: 3.3v
4: 0v
5: 3.3v
6: 0v
7: 3.125v
8: .55v
9: .375v

Surrounding resistors all seem to measure fine. BIOS chip looks untouched. SMC area looks good as well.

Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message: Do the USB ports work? 3V3 getting to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message: USB ports do work, yes. Computer works well with external keyboard/mouse. Pin 22 and 49 of <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is 3.3v, yes.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message: All USB for trackpad/keyboard/BT go to the <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> USB hub. IR port also goes there so probably also dead. Check power to <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> and the Xtal, <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> may also be dead.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message:
Hey Duke, yeah I actually replaced <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> as the first step (I've seen it fail on several before, and that was the fix). I replaced it and no change, but will try another chip just to be sure.

Will update once I try another one--will be tomorrow morning, about the head out. Thanks for the help so far, duke, really appreciate your insights. Will update tomorrow!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message: Check power to the chip and also the Xtal and it's caps. If you have the chip off you can bridge the incoming USB from the PCH to the keyboard chip to see if the PCH USB port is working.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no trackpad/keyboard/bluetooth.
threads.message:
Hey Duke, it looks like the <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> I used to replace the original bad one was also bad after all. What are the odds? Never actually had that happen before (heard about it a few times though). Whew. I was beginning to think this may be an SMC/PCH issue. Thanks, Duke! I appreciate it.

Mark this one "solved"!
